title: %(tenant_id)s returned in API response

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~elliott-davis

comments.content: Can't reproduce the bug, seems like you should replace '%(tenant_id)s' with '$(tenant_id)s' in the endpoint.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~liyingjun

comments.content: Just tried replacing the keystone endpoint with '$(tenant_id)s'.  The url returned is still '%(tenant_id)s' which I find curious.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~elliott-davis

comments.content: Can't reproduce the bug ? Please help me how to produce error lines?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~padmakanth-chandrapati

comments.content:
To reproduce:

1) set osapi_compute_link_prefix = http://<hostname>:<port>/v2/%(tenant_id)s
2) restart the nova-api-os-compute service
3) run nova --debug list to verify broken links
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~elliott-davis

comments.content: You are setting osapi_compute_link_prefix incorrectly, why are you setting this in the first place.   Since this isn't a bug  you should use ask.openstack.org for support.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: This should probably be a docs bug, it seems there is confusion around when you'd use osapi_compute_link_prefix and if you use it, if you should update anything in keystone.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
If you're using chef cookbooks to deploy openstack, the problem might be with this change:

https://github.com/stackforge/cookbook-openstack-compute/commit/a8c79c8f846bf137df801f81ca1616a7e611b478

Where it defaults osapi_compute_link_prefix to the nova endpoint URL which I think is wrong since that's a full URL, not a prefix as this is intended to be used.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: The chef cookbook bug is this: https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-chef/+bug/1418583
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: This does appear to be a problem with the way the chef cookbooks set up that config option.  I would say this is safe to close and it can be addressed on the chef side.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~elliott-davis
